programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peters under extra pressure with Charlie the horse - he belongs to his niece Jess; when Julian sees Jackie Barlow, its usually about one of her alpacas, but today the patient is her little dog Isla.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is called to an emergency on Tom Stockils farm and Peter removes an ominous looking lump for boxer dog Boot; this brings back bittersweet memories for Peter of his own beloved boxer Alf.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: An emotional emergency for Peter at a friends farm; Steves wife is seriously ill, and now her favourite sheeps life is in the balance. Julian tries to remove an abscess on Karine the alpacas chin.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter faces a difficult calving at Ed McDonalds farm; can he get a baby out alive and save mum? Also, Julian faces one of his biggest ever challenges trying to treat one-ton Clydesdale horse Howard.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Deadly Hunters
programme.sub-title: Planet Earth is home to fearsome creatures equipped to maintain their position as apex predators - they are armed to the teeth and possess a predatory prowess few can escape.
programme.desc: We take a look at some of the animals that have led the way in refining their skills as masterful huntsmen; using their size, strength and unique weapons, animals use it all in order to survive.

programme.title: Gladiators
programme.sub-title: A tidal arena of rivers, marshes and shorelines lies in Americas far north; the animals here are the ultimate fighters as they are natures elites and battle-hardened warriors.
programme.desc: There are animals born to fight and destined to face their foe across the planet; armed with weaponry, guile and tactics, these gladiators are prepared for battle. Only champions will reign supreme...

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.sub-title: Tropical rainforests are the most diverse ecosystems on the planet; that means intense competition. Crocodiles in the mangrove forests of Borneo are drawn to the rich variety of species on offer.
programme.desc: We show how animals use their unique attributes to defeat their opponents; they have honed their skills for millennia and have become masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Adapt to Survive
programme.sub-title: Lions, jackals, hyenas, sharks and birds of prey are no stranger to the path of least resistance; they arent fussy eaters - the only objective is securing their next meal.
programme.desc: In this series, we delve into the mysterious world of animals and their methods to survive; take a journey into some of the wild worlds secret survival strategies that allows life to perpetuate.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: In the heart of central America lurks a creature that instils fear in all who encounter it; Jeremy Wade is taken to breaking point and beyond as he relearns everything that he knows about fishing.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Natures Ultimate Survivors
programme.sub-title: A countdown of the creatures that have the fastest skills in nature to kill prey or evade danger quickly; which animal will earn the number one spot?
programme.desc: We explore a diverse range of topics that showcase the incredible survival skills animals have developed over time and feature our top 20 animal species for each of these categories.

programme.sub-title: Head back to the den with the Kakumbi - who are mourning the loss of two pups - and chance upon a hyena lair and a lion pride trying to take down a buffalo.

programme.title: Wild Switzerland
programme.sub-title: This episode explores a relatively obscure part of the country: the Jura Mountains. Its an exciting journey of discovery into an almost untouched wilderness through the seasons.
programme.desc: In the heart of Europe lies Switzerland; majestic mountains, lush green valleys, craggy rock landscapes and Mediterranean lakes - all close together, they are home to unique and diverse wildlife.

programme.title: Wild Switzerland
programme.sub-title: With the rugged mountains of the Tessin Alps and the charming Muggio Valley in its southernmost corner, Ticino is an area so rich in contrast that its hard to beat.
programme.desc: In the heart of Europe lies Switzerland; majestic mountains, lush green valleys, craggy rock landscapes and Mediterranean lakes - all close together, they are home to unique and diverse wildlife.

programme.title: England: A Year in the Wild
programme.sub-title: Spring in the Dales and Moors is the season of new life when the parks animals must find a partner, breed and give birth if they are to create the next generation.
programme.desc: The Dales and North York Moors National Parks cover 1400 square miles of wild terrain in England; we reveal stories about their wildlife and how their lives weave together in these unique parks.

programme.title: England: A Year in the Wild
programme.sub-title: Summer in the Dales and Moors is a time of abundance and growth; these months may be the most productive, but they can also be the most perilous.
programme.desc: The Dales and North York Moors National Parks cover 1400 square miles of wild terrain in England; we reveal stories about their wildlife and how their lives weave together in these unique parks.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are giving an elephant an endoscopy to check on the progress of her cancer treatment, and Paul helps an elephant arriving in AandE with chronic diarrhoea.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: A puppy fights against a deadly disease in the Karratha Vet Hospital, a chicken gets a prosthetic leg, and Dr Lu volunteers in a koala crisis caused by bushfires on Kangaroo Island.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: Patagonia, in the extreme south of the South American continent, is one of the most varied and diverse territories on Earth; we visit penguins, elephant seals, sea lions and orcas.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.
